result.execSummary:
The defendant Clippton A Perryman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/27/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge.
Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking an prescribed medications.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
Successfully complete: a Cogntive Thinking Behavioral Modification course and a parenting course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
To commence forthwith.  Huber release for work, work crew, school, AODA treatment, mental health treatment and medical treatment.  
Court makes no statement regarding electronic monitroing.   Court orders no good time or credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clippton A Perryman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence form in file: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse program.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 2 days.  IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-60 days in the House of Correction with Huber release for work, work crew, school, AODA treatment, mental health treatment, and medical treatment
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/27/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/27/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court makes no statement regarding electronic monitoring.
Court orders no good time or credit.
Sentence to commence FORTHWITH.

Defendant Clippton A Perryman in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court grants joint request for a new plea date. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA on 7/27/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Clippton A Perryman in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Clippton A Perryman in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Ron Dague for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.   NO INFORMATION FILED BY THE STATE.  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/21/15.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendants Jonathan Cefalu and Darnell McCarthy.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
